message: @ericflo I've already done psycopg2, I guess I'll do redis next, the real problem is that each of these still needs to be translated WITH pypy
which is a real nonstarter for reald ev IMO
@alex Yeah I think you're right, needs to be dynamically loaded or something
@alex You think that's going to be hard?
the issue isn't the dynamic loading part
https://github.com/pietern/hiredis-py
Looks like a pretty sweet project
Still super early days though
not as fast as if I write a pypy equivilant that gets all inlined and shit ;)
there's been 2 failed attempts already :( so its non-trivial
Personally I think even if it requires the full PyPy source code to translate a module but allows it to be dynamically loadable that's a start.
But it may not be that simple, it is the #1 bug to making PyPy my goto VM though, because frankly I'll port anything I need :D
hiredis is apparently a c library for calling into Redis
And this is a thin wrapper around it
Looks to be ultra fast
does it still use the network protocol though?
@alex I don't know what you mean.  What's the alternative?  It doesn't attach to the redis process or anything like that.
@ericflo ok that's what I figured, just was confused by "calling into" :)
@alex Dude, a redis client written in rpython would be hot
its the translation part though
@alex Ahh I see
@ericflo been playing with it yesterday and am already impressed by the benchmark
this will be awesome
What does the API look like? From what I can tell it's just one function?  I'm kind of confused.
yeah, it's not much at the moment, only the reader, I'm assuming it's just the start
Yeah, ok, just making sure I'm not missing anything
yah, it's not complete at all yet, but I guess the major hurdle is writing the actual hiredis wrapper
anything else is (even in normal redis-py) just porcelain
Sounds awesome.  If it's really that much faster we'll switch Convore to use it once it's ready.
yah, I hope I have a bit of time this week to hack on it
